common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot-up Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch or experiencing prolonged boot times, particularly after updating to version 11.1.0. This is attributed to data migration during the update process. Recommended solutions include waiting for migration completion, restarting the application, or reinstalling the latest version (11.1.1).

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation for PiecesOS boot-up issue

**Key Points:**

* Many users reported experiencing issues with PiecesOS taking a long time to boot up or failing to launch entirely. 
* The issue appears to be widespread and affecting users on various operating systems, including Windows and macOS. 
* The underlying cause of the problem is identified as a major data migration occurring during the upgrade to PiecesOS version 11.1.0.
* This migration can take several minutes depending on the amount of user data involved.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS taking a long time to start up or getting stuck during the boot-up process.
* Users unable to access PiecesOS features or functionalities due to the incomplete launch.
* Frustration and loss of productivity due to the software malfunction.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **PiecesOS team recommends waiting for the data migration to complete.** They estimate it might take a couple of minutes, especially for users with significant amounts of data.
* **Restarting the Pieces for Developers Desktop application** once the migration is complete.
* **Reaching out to PiecesOS support for further assistance** if the problem persists after the data migration.
* **PiecesOS team releases a new build (version 11.1.1)** aimed at resolving the boot-up issues.
* **Users are advised to uninstall and reinstall the software** with the latest build to benefit from the fix.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been identified and acknowledged by the PiecesOS team.
* A solution has been implemented with the release of version 11.1.1.
* Users are encouraged to update to the latest build and report any unresolved issues.

**Additional Information:**

* The issue appears to be unrelated to specific hardware configurations or third-party software installations. 
* The PiecesOS team is actively monitoring the situation and providing support to affected users.

**Overall, this issue highlights the importance of software updates and the potential for data migration to impact user experience.** It demonstrates the need for clear communication and timely resolution from development teams when encountering widespread software malfunctions.

related_issues.text:
Pieces OS won't run
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Cannot launch Pieces for Developers.  The launcher can't find PiecesOS.  If try to launch PiecesOS from the Pieces Suite it says its already running.  I don't see it in the Systray.  I've Repairing, Resetting, and Reinstalling.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User JasonDWilson reported an issue with the Pieces Windows Desktop version not launching.
* The issue has been assigned to the appropriate team member for investigation.

**Problems identified:**

* The specific cause of the issue is not identified in the conversation.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The author suggested checking related existing issues for clues.
* They also suggested following the debugging steps listed in another ticket (#613).
*  The author offered to jump on a call if the user continues to experience issues.
* The issue was closed.

**Current status/outcome:**

* No further updates are available. It's unclear if:
  * The user successfully resolved the issue using the provided resources.
  * The assigned team member has investigated the problem.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation took place on February 5th, 2025.
* The author mark-at-pieces appears to be affiliated with Pieces-app based on their email address domain.

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Issues and Bugs
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with the Pieces Desktop app, including account linking problems, application crashes, and unresponsiveness.  Troubleshooting steps like reinstallation and account resets have been unsuccessful. The Pieces team is investigating these issues and working on improvements, including a new authentication system.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Account Linking Issues

**Key Points Raised:**

* Johnkennyuk, a Pieces user, reported facing difficulties linking his GitHub and Google accounts.
* Existing account linking flow was identified as complex and not user-friendly.

**Problems Identified:**

* The system wrongly registered Johnkennyuk's Gmail and GitHub accounts as separate due to slight inconsistencies in the capitalized first letter of the email address.
* The existing account linking flow was not handling the inconsistency effectively.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark, a Pieces support member, offered to manually merge the accounts.
* Johnkennyuk requested to keep his Google account with the associated custom domain as the primary account.
* Mark attempted to resolve the issue by resetting Johnkennyuk's GitHub account and advising him to temporarily disable email privacy settings on GitHub.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The account linking process remained unsuccessful due to the capitalized first letter difference between the email addresses.
* Both parties agreed to wait for the new auth service provider to be implemented, expected to be ready by the end of February 2025. This new system is expected to handle such inconsistencies more effectively.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of email address standardization and normalization during user account linking processes.
* The Pieces team is actively working on improving the user experience and resolving current limitations.

common_issues.title: Ollama Installation and Model Download Failures
common_issues.description: Users across Windows and Linux encounter Ollama installation or model download errors. This is often due to missing dependencies in the Pieces OS sandbox environment. Solutions include updating Pieces OS to a version containing the required dependencies or waiting for a patch to the Pieces OS snap package.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub conversation: Ollama installation issue on Pieces-OS

**Key points:**

* Ollama, an LLM, cannot be installed on Pieces-OS due to a curl dependency missing in its sandboxed environment.
* The problem was initially mistaken as missing curl on the user's system.
* The solution involves modifying the Pieces-OS snap package to allow Ollama installations within the sandbox.

**Problems identified:**

* Missing curl in the Pieces-OS sandbox environment prevents Ollama installation.
* Miscommunication internally about package confinement caused initial confusion.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Patching the Pieces-OS snap package to include curl as a dependency.
* Modifying Pieces-OS to allow sandboxed Ollama installation.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The fix is in progress, with an expected release next week (as of January 23rd, 2025).
* Inference functionality is also affected by this issue, preventing local model download as a temporary workaround.
* Users are awaiting the fix to avoid reliance on cloud LLMs.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation spans multiple months, with the latest update provided on February 3rd, 2025.
* Users are actively seeking a resolution to the issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Launching and Access Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties launching Pieces OS on Windows and Linux.  Problems include application not starting, failure to find Pieces OS, and inability to connect to localhost.  Troubleshooting steps include checking port numbers, verifying installation, and reviewing system requirements.

i got this error when opening localhost
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9a5eb05e-1c2f-4e2f-aa3a-205d8791de81)
so
when I was opening the localhost for testing I got this problem
i already search for a solution but i cant fix that
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* @WhyQwerty23811 reported an issue with accessing Pieces.
* @pieces-support-bot provided initial support and directed to relevant resources.
* @mark-at-pieces confirmed that Pieces is not hosted on ports 1000 and 3000.

**Problem Identified:**

* @WhyQwerty23811 was unable to access Pieces, possibly due to an incorrect port.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* @mark-at-pieces clarified that Pieces is hosted on 39300.
* No additional solutions were proposed as @WhyQwerty23811 did not respond with further details.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved due to lack of response from @WhyQwerty23811.
* Further information is needed to determine the root cause and implement a proper solution.

**Next Steps:**

* @WhyQwerty23811 needs to provide additional details about the issue, such as specific error messages or troubleshooting steps taken.
* With more information, @mark-at-pieces or another Pieces team member can investigate and offer further assistance.

recommendations: **Prioritize PiecesOS Boot-up Issues:** Focus on resolving the widespread boot-up problems with PiecesOS, particularly those stemming from the 11.1.0 update. This issue has the highest activity level and causes significant user frustration.

**Address Pieces Desktop App Issues:** Investigate and resolve the various issues reported with the Pieces Desktop app, including account linking problems, crashes, and unresponsiveness. These issues are recurring and impact user experience.

**Improve Ollama Installation Process:** Provide clearer instructions and troubleshooting steps for Ollama installation and model download failures. Address the missing dependencies in the Pieces OS sandbox environment.

**Enhance Linux Support:** Dedicate resources to investigate and resolve the disproportionate number of issues reported by Linux users, particularly regarding application unresponsiveness and database errors.

**Proactive Communication:**  Keep users informed about ongoing issues, planned fixes, and estimated resolution times.  This can be done through in-app notifications, blog posts, or social media updates.
**Improve Issue Triaging:** Ensure the support bot effectively triages issues and directs users to relevant resources. This will help reduce response times and improve user satisfaction.

**Gather More Detailed Reports:** Encourage users to provide comprehensive bug reports, including error messages, logs, and steps to reproduce the issue. This will aid in faster and more efficient debugging.
